speakers.biography: Aphrodice MUTANGANA, Social entrepreneur, Managing Director of FOYO Group Ltd, www.foyo.rw, a company that designed and developed FoyoM-health  and "Napteker" www.napteker.com that is an African online systematic pharmaceutical directory in e-health .Initiator and coordinator of tech Support Incike initiative www.incike.rw, which is a mobile crowd funding that had been used to address one of the problems faced by a portion of survivors of the 1994 Genocide against Tutsi, locally known as “INCIKE”. These are people, whose family members were all decimated during the Genocide, and they are left all alone today and they are more than 70 years old. Member of Global Shapers, Kigali Hub and Member of Private Sector Federation/ICT Chamber and secretary of the Private Sector Federation ICT chamber’s Young ICT entrepreneurs association. Winner of seedstarsWorld 2013 Kigali/Rwanda. FOYOMHealth emerged runner-up in the mhealth & environment category African e-content awards

speakers.name: Peng Zhang
speakers.biography:
Peng Zhang is the founder of GeekPark which is the base camp of innovators in China. Peng Zhang has been working in the media industry for more than 15 years and started his own magazine Business Value in 2009. Peng Zhang has witnessed and experienced the growth and transformation of the IT industry in China. 

His penetrating observation toward different Internet companies has made him to found GeekPark in 2010, which is aimed to enlightening innovators and promoting geek spirit through geekpark.net, regular conferences, events, and its top innovators' alliance.

His efforts have drawn amount of attention from the industry, the annual Innovation Awards has been viewed as Oscar Awards for new born technical products in mainland China; the annual GeekPark Innovation Festival in every January has become a ritual for geeks and innovators to celebrate in their own way.

Tesla founder Elon Musk, Google previous CEO Eric Schmidt and Co-founder of Apple Steve Wozniak have all participated in conferences GeekPark hold during the past years.

Peng Zhang also enjoys good friendship with many founders and CEOs of Internet enterprises, for instance, Lei Jun from XiaoMi, Robin Li from Baidu and etc. Peng Zhang has interviewed Steve Wozniak, the co-founder of Apple; Ray Kurzweil, the founder of Singularity University on stage and been reviewed as the most powerful geek in China by Wozniak.

speakers.name: Klaus Weinmaier
speakers.biography: Klaus is the founder and CEO of “The Engagement Lab” and an innovation facilitator and media strategist in Hamburg and Vienna. He is creating innovative products with and for media organizations and working with organizations on how to implement user centered innovation processes in their business and product development. He is a Stanford-approved Design Thinking coach. Klaus is the Co-founder of derStandard.at, Austria’s leading quality news platform.

speakers.name: Jermain Kaminski
speakers.biography: Jermain C. Kaminski is a network scientist and co-founder of Moviegalaxies, a website visualizing character interaction networks in movies. Most recently, he is a Research Fellow at MIT Media Lab's Macro Connections Group and member of RWTH Aachen's Technology Entrepreneruship Group. Since 2014, he serves as a data analyst for a major German soccer team. Jermain's work is focused on graph technology, computational social science and collective intelligence, with applications in areas such as Bitcoin, crowdfunding, movies, soccer, startup teams, patient communities and venture capital. Jermain is a Fellow at the Royal Society of Arts.

speakers.name: Anne Suphan
speakers.biography:
Seit meinem Studium stellten Soziale Medien für mich ein eigenes, vor allem methodisch spannendes Untersuchungsobjekt dar. Mit der Bearbeitung verschiedenster Projekte zur Nutzung Sozialer Medien und des Internets im allgemeinen ergaben sich für mich eine Vielzahl neuer, weiterführender Fragen zu gesellschaftlichen Konstellationen vor dem Hintergrund der zunehmenden Digitalisierung aller Lebensbereiche. Im Rahmen meiner Dissertation an der Universität St. Gallen habe ich mit Hilfe eines triangulären Forschungsansatz das Inklusionspotential Sozialer Medien im speziellen Kontext der Erwerbslosigkeit analysiert. 

In meinen aktuellen Forschungsprojekten am Lehrstuhl für Soziologie an der Universität Hohenheim beschäftige ich mich mit Ungleichheit, insbesondere im digitalen Kontext. Dazu zählen Aspekte mangelnder Zugänge und Fähigkeiten, sowie die daraus resultierenden Folgen für gesellschaftliche Subgruppen, auch in Bezug auf die Arbeitswelt. Ein weiterer Schwerpunkt bilden visuelle Methoden innerhalb der empirischen Sozialforschung und wie sie in traditionelle quantitative und qualitative Ansätze eingebunden werden können bzw. diese miteinander zu verknüpfen helfen.

speakers.name: Igor Schwarzmann
speakers.biography:
Igor Schwarzmann ist Strategieberater und Researcher. Zusammen mit Johannes Kleske führt er seit 2010 Third Wave, eine Berliner Firma für Zukunftsforschung und Unternehmensberatung, die sich auf die Beobachtung neuer Entwicklungen in digitalen Technologien und deren Auswirkungen auf menschliches Verhalten spezialisiert hat. Sie beraten Kunden wie die IAV, Peta, GIZ und Transparency International wie sie diese Entwicklungen besser verstehen und sich entsprechend anpassen können. Auf ihrer Seite publizieren sie seit Jahren Insights zu Themen wie die "Zukunft der Medien" oder "Mobile Payment".
 
Igor Schwarzmann is a speaker @ MEDIA CONVENTION Berlin 
Find out more on Twitter: @ MCBERLIN15 / #mcb15

speakers.name: Markus Heidmeier
speakers.biography:
Markus Heidmeier, geboren 1971 im Ruhrgebiet. Lebt in Berlin und Dannenfeld, Brandenburg. Mitgründer der Kooperative Berlin. Konzept und Strategie, Redaktion und Rennrad. Berät öffentlich-rechtliche Rundfunkanbieter und Medienhäuser sowie öffentliche Einrichtungen im Kontext Digitalisierung.

Markus arbeitet vor allem zu Themen wie Trimedialisierung und Organsiationsredesign, neue digitale Formate und Produkte sowie dem damit verbundenen Prozessdesign und Changemanagement. 

Co-Erfinder des Speedlab Journalism. Lehrauftrag am Institut für Kommunikationsforschung an der TU Dresden. Schrieb länger für das Data Blog und das Leaks Blog auf Zeit Online. Als Journalist arbeitete Markus viele Jahre für die Programme des Deutschlandradios und der ARD. Im Rahmen eines Beratungsmandats ist er heute auch Co-Leiter des Deutshclandradio.Labs.

speakers.name: Rainer Henze
speakers.biography: Rainer Henze, Gründer und Vorstand der laut.ag, verantwortlich für das Internet-Musikmagazin laut.de und das User Generated Radio™ laut.fm. Geboren 1971, aufgewachsen in Wolfsburg, Studium in Konstanz, Hamburg und London, Abschluss als Diplom-Verwaltungswissenschaftler. Ab 1998 Gründungsgesellschafter der Konstanzer Internetagentur SEITENBAU GmbH, seit 2012 Vorsitzender der Fokusgruppe Audio im Bundesverband Digitale Wirtschaft (BVDW). Unter laut.fm/krautland betreibt er ein Webradio für deutschsprachigen Alternative-Rock.

speakers.name: Lies van Roessel
speakers.biography: Lies van Roessel graduated in 2008 at Utrecht University in Media Studies with a master’s thesis on game literacy. She worked at HKU, University of the Arts Utrecht until 2014 as a teacher and researcher of design processes of applied games. There she contributed to the development of health games and educational games, for instance GATE pilots Carkit and Project Dream as well as follow-up project DJ Fiero. From 2014 Lies works at the Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society (HIIG) in the department Policy & Governance. Her current research is part of the project Circulation of Cultural Goods and concerns practices of innovation and imitation in the games sector. This study explores where to draw the fine line between being inspired by and copying existing games - both from a legal and an informal perspective.

speakers.name: Barbara Rühling
speakers.biography: Barbara is a cultural anthropologist interested in all kinds of collaborative knowledge production, both in filmmaking and in written form. She facilitates Book Sprints where a group a people writes a book collaboratively in 3-5 days, from software manuals to fiction. With her association StreetGriot Media Education she teaches video workshops to kids who autonomously do the prep, production and post-production of their own film ideas. She has been working on documentary films that foster the collaboration between anthropologists and indigenous and local filmmakers.

speakers.name: Laura Vidal
speakers.biography: Laura Vidal is a Venezuelan researcher and a blogger based in France. She's also the Community Manager of Global Voices Latin America and a doctoral student in Education Sciences. Her research takes place at LIRTES (U Paris XII), a lab devoted to transformation in educational and social practices, and focuses on informal learning and intercultral sensitivity. Her writing interests follow intercultural exchanges and cultural practices seen in social media.

speakers.name: Sheilah Birgen
speakers.biography:
She is currently the Community Lead at m:Lab East Africa. A techie by passion, Sheilah is meticulous organizer and resourceful mobiliser.

She is passionate about mobile, entrepreneurship, investing, growth hacking and startups dynamics. She has experience in pitching having listened to over one hundred pitches, coached and mentored several startups.

Sheilah also organized one of the biggest tech event in East Africa: PIVOT East,since 2012. Pivot East is East Africa’s premier mobile startups pitching competition and conference held annually. It is organized to amplify and consolidate the gains of East Africa’s Mobile developer and entrepreneurship ecosystem. She has also coordinated other regional events like ICT4Ag AgriHack Championships 2013 for CTA. M2Work MicroWork 2013 Global Challenge for infoDev and Space Apps Challlenge 2013 for NASA. 

During her free time Sheilah watches sports, writes poems and reads.

speakers.name: Christian Katzenbach
speakers.biography:
Christian leads the research group Internet Policy and Governance at the Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society in Berlin. His research addresses the intersection of technology, communication, and governance. He is a co-initiator of the open access journal Internet Policy Review (http://policyreview.info/) and lead of the research project Circulation of Cultural Goods (http://www.hiig.de/en/project/zirkulation-von-kulturgutern).  His talk on cloning and innovation in the games sector draws from an onjoing case study that investigates how developers and producers in the German games sector handle the fine line between innovation and imitation in their daily practice.

Christian studied media and communication studies, philosophy and computer science in Berlin, Madrid and Potsdam.
speakers.position: Project Lead Internet Policy and Governance

speakers.name: Carline Mohr
speakers.biography:
Ich bin 30 Jahre alt und lebe in Berlin. Ich liebe das Internet und die Herausforderungen, die digitale Vernetzung für den Journalismus mitbringt. Ich habe gelernt, wie man eine Reportage mit 5.000 Wörtern schreibt und weiß, was einen guten Tweet in 140 Zeichen ausmacht. Zurzeit leite ich als "Heart of Social Media" das Ressort Social Media bei bild.de. 

Ich liebe außerdem meine Mutter @ilsemohr, die bereits mehr Tweets abgesetzt hat, als ich selbst. Ich weiß jetzt, dass jeder das Internet lieben kann, egal wie alt man ist. Das erzähle ich auch gerne jedem, der es hören möchte. Das Projekt Familie 2.0. gehört zu denen Dingen, die mich glücklich machen. 

Auf meinem Blog schreibe ich alles auf, was mein Leben bunt macht. Dates mit BWLern und bescheuerte Dialoge bei tinder. Anders als die anderen Kinder sein und nicht gut Auto fahren können. All das halt.
speakers.position: Journalistin. Heart of Social Media. Das gute Zeug

speakers.name: Carola von der Dick
speakers.biography: lives in Berlin where she maintains a concurrent practice of crafts: collages with various materials and knitting all kinds of things and people together. Interests include rituals, performance art, feminist theory. She obtained her B.A. in Southeast Asian Studies and M.A. in European Ethnology from Humboldt University in 2009 and 2012 respectively.

speakers.name: Lea Feldhaus
speakers.biography:
Starting in general psychology, Lea moved on to study the UX of human-machine and human-product interaction. Her leading questions are how well the user can use a product, how much pleasure a person feels before, while and after interacting with a product and whether the product fulfills the purpose it was designed to fulfill. Due to the (truely) interdisciplinary team of innoki, she is inspired by the diverse perspectives on innovation and user friendliness - a great joy!

 

In der klassischen Psychologie begonnen, widmete sich Lea nach ihrem Bachelor-Studium der UX von Mensch-Maschine- und Mensch-Produkt-Interaktion. Ihre Leitfragen sind dabei, wie gut der Nutzer mit dem Produkt umgehen kann, wie groß die Freude vor, während und nach der Interaktion ist und ob das Produkt seinen Zweck für den Menschen erfüllt. Durch das (wirklich) interdisziplinäre Team von innoki werden ihr immer wieder neue Perspektiven auf Innovation und Nutzerfreundlichkeit geboten - eine große Freude!

speakers.name: Eva Schulz
speakers.biography: Ich habe Kommunikation, Kultur, Wirtschaft und Klimbim an der Zeppelin Universität studiert. Meine Abschlussarbeit drehte sich um „Innovation im öffentlich-rechtlichen Fernsehen (und wie sie verhindert wird)“. Parallel dazu schrieb ich eine Kolumne für „Zeit Campus“, entwickelte die erste deutsche Ausgabe der „Wired“ mit und war zwei Jahre lang als Reporterin für das junge Talk- und Reportagemagazin „Klub Konkret“ (EinsPlus) unterwegs. Dann folgten ein Forschungsaufenhalt in den USA und ein halbes Jahr in Israel und Palästina. Seit Kurzem bin ich zurück in Deutschland. Ich blogge unter hurra-blog.de.

speakers.name: Nicolas Zimmer
speakers.biography:
Nicolas Zimmer is an innovation policy strategist and founder with a legal and engineerial background.

Since the beginning of 2013 Nicolas is CEO of Technologiestiftung Berlin, a non-for-profit foundation and think-tank, supporting science and technology and pursuing political agenda-setting for technology-driven subjects in Berlin.

Nicolas was born in 1970 in Berlin, Germany, where he also studied law at the Freie Universität Berlin. In 2000 he graduated with his second state examination. He studied Computer Science at Universität Hagen 2009-2011.

Being a member of the Berlin State Assembly from 1998 to 2011 he was spokesperson in the committee for science and research of the Berlin State Assembly 2006-2011.

Before joining the Technologiestiftung Berlin, Nicolas has worked from 2006 to 2011 as an attorney with a focus on intellectual property and has subsequently been appointed as Permanent Secretary at the Berlin Senate Department for the Economy, Technology and Research.

A great deal of Nicolas’ interest and strength lies in coding and entrepreneurship, he’s founder and CEO of Liberio (http://liber.io), an online-publishing-platform. He's actively supporting Bundesverband Deutsche Startups where he's coordinating the activites related to Industrie 4.0 and the Open Knowledge Foundation Germany where he's a member of the advisory board for codefor.de

speakers.name: David Bovill
speakers.biography:
Dr David Bovill After qualifying in medicine David started the Multimedia Authoring Centre at Charing Cross Hospital, with funding from Philips and Apple Computer. As Senior Developmental Editor for Times Mirror, he produced over 15 cross platform CDROMs including the award winning "Interactive Skeleton". In 1992 David left medicine to form the Virtual Theatre Company, working with immersive environments and laser video projection. He received recognition from the Arts Council for this work, who funded collaborations with Union Dance Company, Laser Creations and real time virtual reality systems.

 

David is one of the founders of Liquid Democracy. Residencies include Flower Bank (2003) - a crypto-art currency with www.monochrom.at, “Hacking the NSA” a 3 month residency at Museums Quartier Vienna, and more recently 2 months at unMonastery.eu.

speakers.name: Cosmin Ene
speakers.biography: Cosmin Gabriel Ene ist CEO und Gründer von LaterPay. Das 2010 von ihm gemeinsam mit Jonas Maurus gegründete Start-up ist ist ein Micropayment-Enabler mit Sitz in München, dessen komplett eigenentwickelte Technologie sich an Anbieter von digitalen Inhalten richtet. Das Unternehmen bietet eine neue Gattung von Bezahlsystemen und vereinfacht den Kauf digitaler Inhalte. Anbieter können mit LaterPay digitale Inhalte schon ab fünf Cent wirtschaftlich verkaufen, ohne dem User eine Vorabregistrierung oder sofortige Bezahlung abzuverlangen. Der User sammelt webseiten-übergreifend fünf Euro an, bevor er zum Bezahlprozess geführt wird. Vor LaterPay baute Cosmin Ene als Gründer den Musik-Sender Deluxe Music auf und war für den Risikokapitalgeber TecVenture Partners tätig.

speakers.name: Ninia Binias
speakers.biography: Ninia Binias (*1983) lebt und arbeitet in Hannover. Seit 2011 ist sie als Online Communication Managerin bei papagei.com tätig, Europas größtem Sprachlernportal. Im August 2014 ist ihr Erzählband "Und ganz, ganz viele Doofe!" im Blaulicht-Verlag erschienen. Als "Ninia LaGrande" bloggt sie über das Leben, Großstadtgeschichten, Feminismus, Kunst, Musik, Fotografie, Mode und Politik. Ab und zu schreibt sie als Gastautorin für andere Blogs und Magazine. Im Mai 2013 hat sie, gemeinsam mit anderen Autor_innen, den Gemeinschaftsblog LesFlaneurs.de gegründet. Ninia tritt regelmäßig auf Poetry Slams in Deutschland und im Ausland auf. Manchmal gewinnt sie. In Göttingen hat sie die Lesebühne „acrobat readers“ gegründet. In Hannover moderiert sie die "Kabarettbundesliga" im Theater am Küchengarten. Aktuell arbeitet Ninia an ihrem ersten Buch und plant die nächsten Reisen, u.a. nach Kanada.

speakers.name: Jana Tepe
speakers.biography: Gründerin von Tandemploy (im Jobsharing). Verfechterin einer menschlicheren Arbeitswelt, die mehr ist als die böse Hälfte von "Work-Life-Balance". Großer Fan von: einfach mal anfangen und nicht immer nur drüber reden.

speakers.name: Paul Lenz
speakers.biography:
If you are part of an organisation from outside the UK and you want mySociety’s help with online democracy or transparency projects, then it is likely that Paul's team will be your first point of contact.

In many cases, Paul will also be the one who comes to see you face-to-face. He has frequently visited Africa, overseeing the re-launch and maintenance of Mzalendo, the Kenyan parliamentary monitoring website (which uses our Pombola platform), and working with groups in Ghana, Nigeria and South Africa.

His work isn’t limited to a single continent however, and he is also working with groups in South America, Europe and Southeast Asia.

Before joining mySociety, Paul worked for five years at British Telecom, the UK’s largest telecommunications company, where he gained invaluable project-management experience.

speakers.name: Fatuma Musa
speakers.biography: Born 12th November 1989 in Mogadishu, Somalia and raised in Kenia Refugee in Bestensee, Brandenburg, since April 2014

speakers.name: Nicolas Lindken
speakers.biography: Nicolas Lindken, im Internet besser bekannt als Tense. Beruf? YouTuber. Und Video-Künstler, Cutter, Kameramann, Texter. Bekannt geworden mit dem reichweitenstarken YouTuber-Comedy-Kollektiv 'ApplewarPictures', einer der ältesten YouTube Kanäle in Deutschland. Ausserdem tätig im Youtube-Wissenssektor unter 'TenseMakesSense', wo er typische Mythen debunkt und im BpB-geförderten Newsformat 'TenseInforms' auf aktuelle Themen eingeht.

speakers.name: Jérémie Zimmermann
speakers.biography: Jérémie Zimmermann is the co-founder and former spokesperson for La Quadrature du Net, an advocacy group that promotes the rights and freedoms of citizens on the Internet. La Quadrature builds tools for citizens to understand the legislative process and participate into it. More specifically, it advocates for the adaptation of French and European legislations to respect the founding principles of the Internet, most notably the free circulation of knowledge. As such, La Quadrature du Net engages in public-policy debates concerning, for instance, freedom of expression, surveillance, copyright, regulation of telecommunications and online privacy. Jérémie is the co-participant of a discussion turned into the book "Cypherpunks" with Julian Assange, Jacob Appelbaum and Andy Muller-Maghun. He was awarded the 2012 Pioneer Award by the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF), for "having been instrumental in the fight against the Anti-Counterfeiting Trade Agreement (ACTA), a far-reaching international treaty that would curtail many Internet freedoms in favour of extremist intellectual property protectionism."

speakers.name: Anna Waldman-Brown
speakers.biography: Anna works with the Fab Lab network and Autodesk to promote creativity and sustainable development through the global Maker Movement. A graduate of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, she received a Fulbright fellowship to research grassroots manufacturing at the Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology in Ghana. She has taught science and engineering in Ghana, Peru, the United States, and Saudi Arabia, and led design thinking workshops in India and Taiwan. She was a co-organizer for the 10th annual Global Fab Lab conference in Barcelona, and is helping organize the 11th conference in Boston, US for next year.

links.title: Research paper on Maker Movement and development

speakers.name: Sylvia Lundschien
speakers.biography: Sylvia Lundschien (*1984) lebt seit 2006 in Berlin, wo sie Europäische Ethnologie und Interkulturelle Kommunikation studierte. In ihrer Abschlussarbeit befasste sie sich mit neuen Arbeitsformen und - konzepten in gegenwärtigen Berliner Club- und Szeneökonomien. Teile der Arbeit wurden auf der Tagung BerMuDa Lab der Berlin Music Days 2013 vorgestellt, 2015 erschien ihr Beitrag "Feiern ist das neue Arbeiten" in der Anthologie "Atmosphären des Populären" im Verlag Gizeh Letters der Hochschule der Populären Künste (hdpk) Berlin. Sylvia Lundschien arbeitet meist an und mit Texten und veröffentlicht im Frohmann Verlag.

speakers.name: Ria Ivandic
speakers.biography: Ria is one of those people that can never stop asking the question “Why?”. During the daytime she focuses her attention on trying to explain what incentivizes political participation as a PhD researcher in Political Economy at King’s College London. But political participation is hardly the only area that fascinates her. Observant of the ever changing societies, she has a great interest in understanding how technology is shaping the future and specifically how social media is shaping our everyday lives. Naturally this goes back to the topic of her academic research as well – how social media today and the social networks around it shape political participation. She has also blogged trying to answer various “Why?”s in political and economic topics and has published Op-Eds in newspapers such as the Telegraph.

speakers.name: Tarek Ahmed
speakers.biography: I am the founder of the Cairo Hackerspace, the first hackerspace in Egypt, est. 2009. I work as a software engineer and stunt-man for commercial films, and alongside hacking/making/inventing/building, I enjoy parkour & skydiving.

speakers.name: Ilse Mohr
speakers.biography: Ilse Mohr bezeichnet sich als Silvernerd und bloggt über Social Media, digitale Gräben, Netzkompetenz und Erlebnisse im Neuland mit ü50. Die Journalistin aus Alfter bei Bonn ist „Damals gab es noch Tippex“ Jahre alt. Sie fühlt sich zu jung, um Babysöckchen für nicht vorhandene Enkel zu stricken und den Anschluss an eine Welt zu verpassen, die sich im Internet experimentierfreudig vernetzt.

speakers.name: Alice Grindhammer
speakers.biography: Alice Grindhammer bezeichnet sich selbst als Müllfachfrau. Als Geschäftsentwicklerin für die ALBA Group bereiste sie die Ränder und Peripherie globaler Märkte und  implementierte  Waste Management Prozesse in extremen Umgebungen. Jetzt setzt Sie interdisziplinäre Kreislaufwirtschaftsprozesse als Lösungsansätze für die globale Abfallkrise zusammen mit Communities um.

speakers.name: Gloria González Fuster
speakers.biography: Gloria González Fuster is a research professor at the Law, Science, Technology and Society (LSTS) Research Group of the Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB), in Brussels (Belgium). Author of a monograph on the emergence of the right to the protection of personal data as a fundamental right of the European Union, she has contributed to numerous international research projects on privacy and personal data protection and their relation with security and governance. Her academic background encompasses Law, Communication Sciences and Modern Languages and Literatures. She has also been active for more than a decade in the promotion of copyleft artists in Spanish media, and is currently a regular columnist at Blisstopic magazine.

speakers.name: Mayte Schomburg
speakers.biography:
Mayte is a fellow at the Berkman Center for Internet & Society at Harvard University as well as initiator and chair of Publixphere e.V. Publixphere is a non-profit organization running the non-partisan and independent political discussion platform Publixphere.net. From 2012-14 she coordinated the Global Network of Internet & Society Research Centers (NoC) at the Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society (HIIG) in Berlin. In 2011, Mayte initiated a research project on "democratic legitimacy and the political public sphere" at the chair for European Law at the Free University of Berlin. Mayte holds a doctorate in international relations from the University of St. Gallen, Switzerland, where she previously studied. From 2009-10 she worked for the European Capital of Culture "Essen for the Ruhr 2010". Mayte currently spends her time between Cambridge, USA and her home town of Hamburg, Germany. 

[profile picture: (c) Asmus Henkel]

links.title: Fellow, Berkman Center for Internet &amp; Society at Harvard University

speakers.name: Mat Sayer
speakers.biography: Too young to be this paranoid.

speakers.name: Thomas Renger
speakers.biography:
Irgendwann 1994 ins Internet gefallen, wohnt jetzt da und in Stuttgart.

Blogger, Softwareentwickler, Freifunker, ...

speakers.name: Samer Shawar
speakers.biography: New Media Artist and an Entrepreneur, have a good experience in Robotics and Interactive installation, working on spreading my knowledege into the Palestinian community and building a makers community inside Palestine through out the Challenges we face due to the Political Situation, and creating the enviroment and the space for a new innovation in technology and invention that Paletinians can create, at least to find solutions for a daily living problems here that we face as a Palestinians.

speakers.name: Christian Macht
speakers.biography: Originally a student of languages, Christian found his true passion with Mozilla's Teaching the Web initiative and as an active member of the European Youth Parliament in Germany.

speakers.name: Laura Frühmann
speakers.biography: Laura Frühmann is a political sociologist with a background in European history and cultural anthropology. After graduating, she wrote the book 'European Alternatives: in search of a concept to help bridge the gap between the EU and its citizens (Case study: The Netherlands)'. She is currently the coordinator for European Alternatives Amsterdam, where she organised the Transeuropa Festival and recently created a serious game about European citizenship for youth in lower education, among other things. During the European elections Laura was one of the founders of Reclaim Europe, a platform for critical citizens with a passion for Europe.

speakers.name: Tobias Schwarz
speakers.biography: German, balding slowly, hopefully with grace. A carnival junkie, who, after studies in business in Mannheim and Paris, and European Politics and Policy at the LSE, is currently living in his hometown of Mainz, Germany, again. Worked for the Labour administration during a a research job at the House of Commons, but difficult to place in German party-political terms. Liberal in the true sense of the term. His political writing is mostly on A Fistful of Euros and on facebook these days. Occasional Twitter user and songwriter. His personal blog is

speakers.name: Hagen Terschüren
speakers.biography: I like to understand things. That is why I spent most of my time to stuff my brain with stuff. My remaining time is spent ranting and doing bad puns on Twitter.

speakers.name: Saad Chinoy
speakers.biography:
Saad is a professional geek with a passion for coffee, technology, and the OpenSource way of doing things. For a living he conceptualizes tech solutions for Tusitala, the digital publishing arm of Potato Productions. Tusitala means "story-teller". He's recently been developing a platform to enable Asian storytellers to leverage the accessibility and reach of all things digital to get their stories published. Tusitala is on the look out for Asian stories that adopt the interactivity of the digital medium to go beyond the page, without trying to replace it. "trans-media storytelling" as the marketese would have it.

Saad also volunteers with several non-profits and strongly believes that social enterprises should be the key users of and contributors to OpenSource tech. Saad is a self-confessed maker and coffee person.

speakers.name: Katrin Zinoun
speakers.biography: Katrin Zinoun is a cultural anthropologist working currently as freelance writer and translator. Since 2011 she is Lingua Editor for Global Voices German. She studies Education and is interested in learning processes and intercultural education. Her focus lies on the question how we can overcome borders with the help of digital media.

speakers.name: Tine Nowak
speakers.biography:
Tine Nowak ist Wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiterin für Medienpädagogik an der TU Darmstadt. Hier beschäftigt sie sich in der Lehre mit dem Thema Lernen und Lehren mit digitalen Medien (insbesondere in der Lehrerausbildung).

Sie podcastet seit Januar 2013 unter www.kulturkapital.org zu den Themen Medien, Bildung und Kultur.

speakers.name: Danko Nikolic
speakers.biography: I am a brain-mind scientist dedicated to adressing the hardest problems. The main motive for my studies is the explanatory gap between the brain and the mind. My interest is in how the physical world of neuronal activity produces the mental world of perception and cognition. My research led me to introduce the concepts of ideasthesia (meaning "sensing concepts") and practopoiesis (meaning "creation of actions"; http://www.danko-nikolic.com/practopoiesis/). I want to use this theoretical knowledge to create artificial systems that are biologically-like intelligent and adaptive.

speakers.name: Walter van Holst
speakers.biography: Walter has a background in both information management and law. His day job is drafting IT-contracts and negotiating them. By night he moonlights as a volunteer for Vrijschrift and is their liaison to EDRi, European Digital Rights, a European umbrella for NGOs in the field of digital rights. His Twitter handle is @whvholst.

speakers.name: M. C. McGrath
speakers.biography: M. C. is the founder of Transparency Toolkit, a non-profit that uses open data and makes free software to better understand surveillance and human rights abuses. He is also a Thiel Fellow and an Echoing Green Fellow. Previously, M. C. graduated from Boston University with a degree in civic technology and did research at the MIT Media Lab.

speakers.name: Elle Nerdinger
speakers.biography:
Wohnhaft in Düsseldorf

Studium der Germanistik mit Nebenfächern Geschichte und Kunst- und Designwissenschaft an der Bergischen Universität Wuppertal

Wissenschaftliche Referentin im Bereich Kulturpolitik

Mitglied im Chaos Computer Club

Mitglied im Cyborgs e.V.

speakers.name: Denise Karunungan
speakers.biography: Pursuing expertise in design, communications and marketing, Denise works for the Open Data Lab Jakarta (a project of the Web Foundation) building, strengthening and implementing communications and engagement strategies. Denise has roots in information design and digital media, a background thoroughly used as she worked several years in the advertising and creative industry. Prior to jumping to the NGO sector, she spent time in the games industry studying and developing educational and social games for various platforms, as well as the successful community campaigns and public engagement surrounding these products. When not engaged with the more 'serious' work, Denise prides herself in her fiction-writing skills and finds herself occupied with her attempt to one day become a polyglot.

speakers.name: Jan von Meppen
speakers.biography: I’ve always disliked school. I quickly became a master at avoiding classes with the exception of those attended by girls I liked and subjects I enjoyed. In any case, I received spectacularly bad grades and in the end I admitted defeat, dropped out and became a musician. A few years later, (through divine intervention or cosmic irony depending how you look at it) I was admitted to the University of Oxford, where I studied philosophy. After I discovered that nobody wanted to pay me for thinking, I took a job at Harley-Davidson. Flushed with funds and bored with motorbikes, I set out on a glamorous new career as a film producer in America. There, I produced some spectacularly unsuccessful films before I discovered an enthralling new trend: "Transmedia". I became fascinated with ARGs and their novel approach to audience engagement. I absorbed everything I could find on the subject. Back in Europe, whilst working on a VOD platform I started experimenting with ARGs in schools. Ironically, these experiments were successful and what I learned I would like to share with you.

speakers.name: Andrew Lamb
speakers.biography:
Andrew is an active advisor to Field Ready, which uses disruptive technologies such as 3D printing to transform disaster relief supply chains.

Andrew works for the global engineering body the World Federation of Engineering Organisations (on initiatives such as engineering capacity building in Africa), for the World Bank (on local government open data in Tanzania); and for the 'Global Dimension in Engineering Education' project in Europe (on supporting academics).

He was the first staff Chief Executive of Engineers Without Borders UK until summer 2013 where he made significant progress in the organisation's scope and effectiveness, including a much stronger focus on engineering education and developing its 'massive small change' philosophy. He is a director of the Appropedia Foundation which runs the www.appropedia.org website - a sustainability wiki. He is a trustee of disaster relief training organisation RedR UK and of the Humanitarian Centre in Cambridge, which convenes partnerships to tackle the root causes of poverty. He was the technical editor of the world's first global report on engineering, the UNESCO Engineering Report, which focused on opportunities and challenges for development. Among Andrew’s current interests is the use of Lego to promote generational change in sub-Saharan Africa, and developing the ‘massive small change’ concept for wider use across society.

speakers.name: Carina Bischof
speakers.biography:
Expert in Upcycling Fashion

Over the last seven years Carina Bischof is active in the sustainable fashion scene, especially in Upcycling. 

She gained first international experience in terms of upcycling as a design assistant at the renowned label "From Somewhere" in London.

In 2010 she founded together with three colleagues (Arianna Nicoletti, Luise Barsch and Jonathan Leupert) the upcycling label "aluc".

A year after they opened the first concept store for upcycling fashion in Berlin. The team behind the Upcycling Fashion Store is

working now since five years to establish the upcycling concept in the German fashion scene.

They initated a wide range of projects (e.g. the upcycling-fashion blog, the upcycling label "aluc", the concept store, the organization of a monthly round table and an upcycling material sourcing project) and gained practical expertise by that. 

Since January 2014 Carina Bischof is an active board member of the Fashion Revolution Day in Germany.

speakers.name: Dominik Schott
speakers.biography: Lange Zeit studierte Dominik Kulturwissenschaften und Psychologie an den Universitäten Heidelberg und Rom und stieg so Semester für Semester tiefer in die Abgründe der deutschen Hochschullandschaft hinab. Abgeschreckt von den Elfenbeintürmen der deutschen Wissenschaftskultur zog er nach Berlin, um sich verstärkt auf kreatives Schreiben und irgendwas mit Medien zu konzentrieren. So landete er in der Spielebranche und schreibt seit Ende 2013 beruflich über Videospiele und wie sie uns jenseits des Tellerrandes als Kulturgut und Kunstform beeinflussen und formen. Fehlenden Orientierungssinn gleicht er mit seiner Liebe zur Schwerkraft und Koffein aus.

speakers.name: Bernhard Pörksen
speakers.biography:
Bernhard Pörksen ist Professor für Medienwissenschaft an der Universität Tübingen. Er erforscht die Inszenierungsstile in Politik und Medien und hat sich auf die Analyse von Empörungskommunikation spezialisiert. Seine Bücher über das konstruktivistische und systemische Denken (u.a. mit dem Kybernetiker Heinz von Foerster und dem Neurobiologen Humberto Maturana) wurden in mehrere Sprachen übersetzt. 2008 wurde er zum „Professor des Jahres“ gewählt. Zuletzt schrieb er – gemeinsam mit Hanne Detel – das Buch „Der entfesselte Skandal. Das Ende der Kontrolle im digitalen Zeitalter.“
 
Bernhard Pörksen is a speaker @ MEDIA CONVENTION Berlin 
Find out more on Twitter: @ MCBERLIN15 / #mcb15

speakers.name: Alper Cugun
speakers.biography: Alper Cugun (MSc, Delft University of Technology) is an engineer and partner at Hubbub, a Dutch/German design studio that does strategy, invention and prototyping around games and play. Alper was active in the Amsterdam startup scene, led a data visualization agency and helped found the Open State Foundation, a Dutch open government institution. Alper is currently based in Berlin.

speakers.name: Andrea Van der Grinten
speakers.biography:
Andrea van der Grinten

Seasoned consumer marketing manager with marketing experience within FMCG, e-commerce and media in the United States and Europe. Member of European Alternatives Amsterdam and project leader in the 'Europawijzer'- serious game development process.

speakers.name: Mikael Brain
speakers.biography: Screen director, originally from Australia and now working out of Berlin. Mikael directs high-end promos for music venues and arts institutions, as well as documentaries, comedy and ads. With a colourful and diverse background across various roles within the motion picture industry, his acute understanding of the medium has brought clarity and innovation to Mikael's own projects, as well as those of fellow artists and established clients. He has directed or collaborated on projects that have screened at Oscar-qualified film festivals and German/Austrian TV, been nominated for awards at Hollywood's Streamy Awards, and exhibited at the ICA (London), NGV (Melbourne) and Ars Electronica (Linz).

speakers.name: Mareike Foecking
speakers.biography:
Studium an der Kunstakademie Düsseldorf

seit 1996 Arbeit als freie Photographin

Professorin für Photographie PBSA university of applied arts Düsseldorf

speakers.name: Konrad Lauten
speakers.biography: Kurz: Speisen, Feiern, Crowdfunding, Kräuter, Entwickeln. Seit 27 Jahren in Berlin viel von allem.

speakers.name: Danica Radisic
speakers.biography: Danica, better known as Niki to the world wide web, is a communications consultant, writer, blogger, poet, and native speaker of Serbian, English and Portuguese. A Serbian native, Niki was born and raised on the Iberian Peninsula, with some time spent in the Middle East and U.S.. When she isn't gladly dedicating her time to Global Voices as Central & Eastern Europe Editor, she plays a part-time adult as a mom of two and CEO of Krazy Fish Consulting. In the free time she doesn't have but manages to find, she listens and shares on Twitter and other social networks as NikiBGD.

speakers.name: Dirk Franke
speakers.biography: Dirk Franke has battled, baffled, engaged and trolled the trolls for over 10 years. One of the earliest 15 administrators of the German Wikipedia he has seen all the vandals, all the trolls and experienced an immeasurable amount of passive-aggresiveness. He has seen the trolls come and go and he has seen the pink fluffy unicorns stay. Franke worked for Wikimedia Deutschland for two years in 2013/2014 in community communications and is now a freelance communitymanager.

speakers.name: Annie Machon
speakers.biography:
Annie Machon was an intelligence officer for the UK's MI5 in the 1990s, before leaving to help blow the whistle on the crimes and incompetence of the British spy agencies.

She is now a writer, media commentator, political campaigner, and international public speaker on a variety of related issues: the war on terrorism, the war on whistleblowers, the war on drugs, and the war on the internet.

She is also the European director of LEAP (www.leap.cc).

Annie has an MA (Hons) Classics from Cambridge University.

Website: www.anniemachon.ch

Book: Spies, Lies and Whistleblowers: MI5 and the David Shayler Affair. Book Guild Ltd. ISBN-10: 185776952X (2005)

speakers.name: Stefanie Schirmer
speakers.biography:
Stefanie Schirmer is a Software Engineer at Etsy and an alumna of Hacker School in New York.

She studied Applied Computer Science in the Natural Sciences in Bielefeld, Germany, where she developed a type checker for a compiler of a language for optimization problems. In her following PhD project she developed metrics for the structure comparison of RNA molecules. Working as a postdoc at the cancer research institute of Université de Montréal, she found her way to Hacker School and to Etsy in Brooklyn and Berlin.

In the community team she build spaces for human interaction on the Etsy site and on mobile devices. Together with Hannes Mehnert and Jens Ohlig, she wrote a book about functional programming and curry cooking.

speakers.name: Christian Römer
speakers.biography: Christian studierte Theaterregie an der New York University. Er ist spezialisiert auf die Entwicklung von Festivals und Workshopprogrammen, u.a. für die EXPO 2000 und das Deutsch-Französische Jugendwerk. Als Produzent der Neuköllner Oper erarbeitete er über 30 Uraufführungen der "4. Oper" Berlins. Seit 2011 kümmert er sich für die Heinrich-Böll-Stiftung um Kultur und Neue Medien, entwickelte im Team u.a. die Konferenzen "Mobilize!" und  "Theater und Netz". Seine Formate untersuchen die Schnittstellen zwischen Netz- und Kulturgesellschaft.

speakers.name: Thomas Lohninger
speakers.biography:
Thomas Lohninger is an anthropologist and programmer. His activist work is focused on the issue of net neutrality. He worked as a policy advisor for the European Digital Rights advocacy group during the key phase of the EU regulation on net neutrality, has been an expert witness in front of the German Bundestag on the issue of net neutrality, and works as an instrumental part of the SaveTheInternet.eu campaign, which aims at the preservation of net neutrality in Europe.

He is a member of the executive board of the Arbeitskreis Vorratsdaten Österreich (AKVorrat), and also works as a volunteer for the Digital Gesellschaft and the Initiative für Netzfreiheit.

_____________

Thomas Lohninger ist Anthropologe und Programmierer. Das Thema Netzneutralität ist Schwerpunkt seiner aktivistischen Arbeit. Er hat in der heißen Phase der EU-Verordnung zur Netzneutralität bei European Digital Rights als Policy Advisor gearbeitet, war zum Thema Netzneutralität als parlamentarischer Sachverständiger im Deutschen Bundestag und arbeitet maßgeblich an der Kampagne SaveTheInternet.eu zum Erhalt der Netzneutralität in Europa.

Er ist Geschäftsführer des Arbeitskreis Vorratsdaten Österreich und engagiert sich daneben ehrenamtlich bei der Digitalen Gesellschaft und der Initiative für Netzfreiheit.

speakers.name: Jan Kalbitzer
speakers.biography:
Jan is a psychiatrist and head of the research group Internet and Mental Health at the Department of Psychiatry and Psychotherapy of the Charité -University Medicine Berlin. Before he came to the Charité in 2009, he studied philosophy and medicine in Freiburg i. Br. and Hannover and then worked as a researcher at the Universities of Copenhagen and Oxford. In Copenhagen, he completed a PhD program on seasonal changes in the environment and their effect on neurotransmission. He described how environments that appear potentially hostile and dangerous are associated with changes in brain chemistry that can lead to more dogmatic behavior. From 2011 to 2014 he headed the neurochemistry research group of his department.

While being on a one-year paternity leave in 2014, an older case study he had written on "Twitter psychosis" appeared online and caused international attention of the media. He was stunned by this great need for information of the public (combined with a great potential to overreact of the mass media). So when he returned from paternity leave in 2015, he changed his research focus and founded a center for Internet and mental health for which he and his team received the Max Rubner Award - The Innovation Award For Trailblazers At the Charité.

speakers.name: Rebecca Cotton
speakers.biography:
* 2,5 years of Piratenpartei - intersectional work on discrmination, office management for the Tempelhofer district faction, arbitrating, something liquid

* Two years community and project management at Wikimedia Germany

* Currently doing data science for a crowdsourced marketresearch startup in Berlin

speakers.name: Max Orgeldinger
speakers.biography:
Max Orgeldinger ist Senior Stratege bei Torben, Lucie und die gelbe Gefahr in Berlin. Ihn beschäftigen der Einfluss des technologischen Fortschritts auf die Gewohnheiten der Menschen und der Einfluss der Gewohnheiten der Menschen auf den technischen Fortschritt. Nach einem Studium an der European Business School kam der 1989 geborene Wahlberliner 2011 zu TLGG.

Seine aufmerksames Auge für Trends und sein Gespür fürs Verhalten machten den heute 25jährigen schnell zu einem gefragten Strategen und Gesprächspartner, wenn es um Digitalisierung und das soziale Netz geht. Bei TLGG betreut Max Orgeldinger Kunden wie die Lufthansa und E.ON und war Teil des Teams, das die Gründung der E.ON-Konzerneinheit für digitale Transformation mit vorbereitete.

Max Orgeldinger stammt aus Bayern. Wenn alle Umstände stimmen, ist ein Vortrag in der entsprechenden Kleidung möglich.

speakers.name: Cornelia Reindl
speakers.biography:
Tätigkeitsfeld: Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement | Training/Coaching | Prozessberatung

Cornelia treiben seit jeher Fragen rund um die Leistungsfähigkeit und Gesundheit von Unternehmen und den Menschen, die darin arbeiten, um und an. Sie beschäftigt sich mit Instrumenten des Personalmanagements und Ansätzen der Organisationsentwicklung, mit denen Menschen, auch vor dem Hintergrund von Wertewandel und demografischen Veränderungen, leistungsfähig, motiviert und zufrieden ihren größtmöglichen Beitrag in ihrem Unternehmen leisten können. Was ist nötig, damit Mensch und Unternehmen gut und für beide Seiten zielführend zusammen arbeiten? Was braucht es, damit Menschen ihre Arbeits- und damit Lebenszeit sinnvoll verbringen können? Was bedeutet in diesem Zusammenhang Erfolg? Wie gestaltet sich gute Arbeit? Diese Fragen treiben Cornelia Reindl um und an. Im Rahmen von Projekten mit Schwerpunkt Gesundheitsmanagement begleitet Cornelia Reindl Unternehmen sowie einzelne Mitarbeiter aus verschiedensten Branchen auf dem Weg der Kultur- und Werteveränderung hin zu guter Arbeit.

speakers.name: Juliet Wanyiri
speakers.biography: Juliet Wanyiri is the founder of Foondi Workshops and has been using her background in engineering and design to leverage local technologies for bottom-up innovation. She is also a Stanford FabLearn Fellow and run collaborative design workshops with communities on design thinking, product design and appropriate technologies.

speakers.name: Rayna Stamboliyska
speakers.biography:
Rayna Stamboliyska earned her PhD in Genetics and Bioinformatics from the Ludwig-Maximilians University of Munich, Germany, and is currently completing a Master’s degree in Defence, Security and Crisis Management at the Institut de Relations Internationales et Stratégiques in Paris, France. Rayna advises decision-makers on knowledge technologies in the Middle East/North Africa and Eastern Europe/the Balkans. She is founder of RS Strategy, partners with Berlin-based r0g_agency and Belgrade-based Krazy Fish, and launched Open MENA in early 2014 to promote open knowledge in the MENA region. 

Rayna is also an independent researcher and writer with a particular interest in social justice and open technologies. She has always seized the opportunity to live and travel in different places around the world thus connecting and interacting with people from diverse backgrounds. Speaking several languages and embracing multiple cultures has ultimately tainted her professional path: that of a science-trained ‘forensic’ technology geekette passionately advocating for free/open source software, open data and free culture. Her research focuses on freedom of expression in the wider Mediterranean, impact of technology on populations in conflict and post-conflict zones and open science as a development tool.

speakers.name: Sebastian Sooth
speakers.biography: @sebaso lebt und arbeitet seit 20 Jahren mit dem Netz. Manchmal aber auch mit gedrucktem Papier. Und weil das jetzt modern ist, auch mit bewegtem Bild im WWW.

speakers.name: Luiza Prado
speakers.biography: Design researcher interested in the intersections between queerness, decolonial feminism, cyborg bodies and speculative design; currently a doctoral candidate at the University of the Arts in Berlin.

speakers.name: Anwen Roberts
speakers.biography: Anwen is a science and tech writer, journalist and translator from Berlin. She's into maths and stats and physics, but also the social sciences, and is interested in all the ways that they overlap in the information society of tomorrow and today.

speakers.name: Roy Ombatti
speakers.biography: Roy has a background in Mechanical Engineering and is a maker and footwear innovator based in Nairobi, Kenya. Currently he set up a local 3D printing industry, while working with techfortrade, to produce 3D printers as well as filament all from waste materials. His project 'Happy Feet' aims to provide bespoke shoes for people with foot deformities as a result of the jigger sand flea in Kenya. He is an alumni and has been an organiser of the International Development Design Summit (IDDS) and went on to organise IDDS Design for Development workshops around the world. Roy is a maker educator and consequently he is a Stanford Fablearn Fellow.

speakers.name: Simon Köhl
speakers.biography: Simon Köhl studierte Politikwissenschaften und Wirtschaftswissenschaften an der Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München. Er ist Gründer der Lernplattform Serlo, geschäftsführender Vorstand der Gesellschaft für freie Bildung e. V. und Mitgründer der Ory GmbH. Simon wird als Stipendiant von Ashoka PEP und als Verantwortlicher der Robert Bosch Stiftung gefördert. Für das Bündnis freie Bildung erarbeitet er Handlungsempfehlungen an die Politik zur Förderung von Open Educational Resources.

speakers.name: Simon Tennant
speakers.biography:
Simon Tennant leads the team reinventing messaging. He grew up in South Africa, and worked in London, San Francisco, Munich and now Berlin. 

Before launching Buddycloud, Simon built secure banking systems and a massive music streaming service before taking up the challenge of reinventing messaging.

When not with the team in Berlin, Simon sits on XMPP Standards Foundation board, runs marathons and climbs mountains.

speakers.name: Corinna Sy
speakers.biography:
Corinna Sy – Freischaffende Designerin und Mitbegründerin von CUCULA.

Sie hat 2009 ihr Studium an der Köln International School of Design mit einem Diplom absolviert und war anschließend im Bereich Trendresearch, Konzeption und Beratung im Automobilbereich tätig.

Als Designerin befasst sie sich mit den gestalterischen Möglichkeiten im Rahmen gesellschaftspolitischer Themen.

speakers.name: Fieke Jansen
speakers.biography:
Fieke works at Tactical Tech, where she researches and writes on the Politics of Data and digital shadows. She hopes to bring more transparency to the global data industry. Prior to moving to Berlin, Fieke worked on the intersection of the internet, social change and security, working at Hivos to set up and manage their digital emergency programme for human rights defenders and activists. She also co-authored a book called Digital AlterNatives.

Fieke holds a Masters degree in International Communication and an Advanced Masters in International Development Cooperation. She is interested in understanding the new spaces, grey areas and changing dynamics that technologies bring to the world.

speakers.name: Marc Böhlen
speakers.biography:
Artist-Enginer Marc Böhlen aka RealTechSupport offers the kind of support technology really needs. Böhlen designes information processing systems that generate new qualities from quantitative materials. Speculative Robotics / Public Computational Media / Water works.

Böhlen is Professor of Media Study at the University of Buffalo, NY, USA. www.realtechsupport.org

speakers.name: Sebastian Däschle
speakers.biography:
Sebastian Däschle - Freischaffender Designer 

 

arbeitet im Spannungsfeld zwischen Gesellschaft, Wirtschaft und Kultur mit den gestalterischen wie konzeptionellen Mitteln des Designers.

 

Er ist Ideengeber und Mitbegründer des Unternehmens „dua-Collection“ und der interdisziplinären Künstlergruppe „crucible“.

 

Als Möbeldesigner hat er mit der international renommierten Galerie Rossana Orlandi in Mailand zusammen gearbeitet.

 

Seit 2014 ist er Teil des interdisziplinären Projektes CUCULA das auf verschiedenen Ebenen in aktuelle gesellschaftliche Geschehnisse eingreift.

speakers.name: Anita Gohdes
speakers.biography: I am a post-doctoral researcher at the University of Mannheim.  Starting in August '15, I'll be a post-doctoral research fellow at the Belfer Center in the Harvard Kennedy School. My research focuses on political violence, state repression and the measurement of human rights. I'm currently researching how changes in access to communication technology and social media affect the dynamics of wartime violence against civilians. I spend a lot of time thinking about how to accurately quantify violence, and writing code that does that. Since 2009, I have been working for the Human Rights Data Analysis Group, a non-profit, non-partisan organization that applies rigorous scientific methods to the analysis of human rights violations around the world. We just published a report for the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights that assessed and analysed the patterns of documented fatalities in the Syrian conflict.

speakers.name: Jessy Medernach
speakers.biography: Jessy Medernach ist Mitgründerin von CUCULA – Refugees Company for Crafts and Design und im Team zuständig für die Bereiche Bildung, Recht und Soziales. Nach Studien der Erziehungswissenschaften und Lehramt und einem Master in Kinderrechten kam sie über spannende Pfade bei Amnesty International, dem Deutschen Kinderhilfswerk und dem innovativen JugendtheaterBüro Berlin beim Herzensprojekt CUCULA an. Neben der gemeinsamen Konzeptentwicklung leitet sie das CUCULA Education-Programm, bietet kreative Workshops und Schulunterricht an und steht beim bürokratischen und rechtlichen Alltag zur Seite.

speakers.name: Nadine Kuhla von Bergmann
speakers.biography: Nadine hat Ihr Architekturstudium an der Kuntshochschule Berlin-Weißensee abgeschlossen. Seit 2002 arbeitete sie in verschiedenen Büros in Berlin und Kapstadt an Projekten in den unterschiedlichsten  Maßstäben, vor allem an der Entwicklung städtischer Rahmenpläne. 2011 ging sie als Gastwissenschaftlerin an das Potsdamer Institut für Klimafolgenforschung (PIK) und wurde dort von Dr. Fritz Reusswig in einer transdisziplinären Forschergruppe für klimaneutrale Stadtentwicklung ausgebildet. Von 2012 bis 2013 arbeitet sie unter der Leitung von Prof. Pahl-Weber an dem nationalen Megacities Forschungsprojekt “Young Cities” am Institut für Stadt- und Regionalplanung der TU Berlin und setzte sich mit Herausforderungen im Bereich energie- und ressourcenschonendes Urban Design auseinander. Momentan unterrichtet und forscht sie am Fachgebiet für Städtebau und nachhaltige Stadtplanung, CHORA City & Energy, unter der Leitung von Prof. Bunschoten an der TU Berlin. 2013 gründete Nadine die Platform “Creative Climate Cities” and engagiert sich aktiv an der Umsetzung von “Klima Kiezen” bzw. intelligenten Quartieren, die auf der Integration von sozialen und technologischen Innovationen beruhen.

speakers.name: Isabell Welpe
speakers.biography: Isabell M. Welpe is a Full Professor at the Technische Universität München and holds the Chair for Strategy and Organization. Her research interests are in the area of strategic leadership, organizational design and the impact of digital and social technologies.

speakers.name: Tim Schumacher
speakers.biography:
Tim Schumacher ist Chairman und Advisor der Eyeo GmbH mit Sitz in Köln. Eyeo ist die Firma hinter dem weltweit berühmten Adblockers Adblock Plus, welcher bislang mehr als 350 Millionen Mal heruntergeladen wurde. Seit 2012 unterstützt er die von Eyeo ins Leben gerufene "Initiative für akzeptable Werbung". Diese soll Werbetreibende dazu motivieren, ihre Werbung besser und nachhaltiger zu gestalten und schafft somit eine nachhaltige Lösung für das wachsende Problem der Ablehnung von Online-Werbung durch die Nutzer.

Außerdem war Tim Mitgründer und langjähriger CEO der börsennotierten Kölner Sedo AG (Sedo.com) mit aktuell € 130 Mio € Umsatz und ca. 350 Mitarbeitern. Tim ist aus der deutschen Start-Up-Welt nicht mehr wegzudenken und ist seit 2012 teils als Business-Angel, teils mit operativem Engagement in der Szene unterwegs. Zu seinen aktuellen Start-Ups gehören Eyeo.com/Adblockplus.org, Aklamio, Stuffle, Yieldkit und Ecosia.

speakers.name: Yannick Haan
speakers.biography: Yannick Haan arbeitet bei Wissenschaft im Dialog und ist dort Projektmanager für das Projekt "Hack your City!". Zuvor war er wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter im Deutschen Bundestag und hat seine Masterarbeit zum Thema E-Partizipation im Stadtentwicklungsbereich verfasst. Er ist Autor des Buches 'Gesellschaft im Digitalen Wandel' das im Jahr 2013 bei Friedrich-Ebert-Stiftung erschienen ist. Ehrenamtlich engagiert er sich als Sprecher des Forums Netzpolitik der Berliner SPD und ist Botschafter der Stiftung für die Rechte zukünftiger Generationen.

speakers.name: Aral Balkan
speakers.biography:
Aral Balkan is the founder and lead designer of Ind.ie, a social enterprise creating independent alternatives to Spyware 2.0.

Aral's work protects fundamental freedoms, human rights, and democracy by creating independent consumer technologies that don't spy on you.

He is the author of the Ind.ie Manifesto.

Aral is currently working on coding the core of the Ind.ie platform, a beautiful distributed social network called Heartbeat.

speakers.name: Johanna Frelin
speakers.biography: Johanna is CEO at the creative business school Hyper Island, which she has empowered to grow to a global scale in four years. Previously she has spent many years at the Swedish public service television company SVT in several leading positions, the most recent one being Director of Program Production. Johanna has vast experience of Leadership in Change and Organisational Development. In 2013 Johanna was awarded the price "CEO of the Year" by Motivation.se and Executive People. Right now she is nominated to "Leader of the Year" by the publication Chef in Sweden.

speakers.name: Joanne Pouzenc
speakers.biography: Joanne Pouzenc is an independent architect / curator / urban researcher / photographer amateur / busy traveler based in Berlin. After 8 years of architectural practice between France and New York, she joins the Bauhaus Dessau foundation program for urban research. In 2011, she co-founds of CollageLab (www.collagelab.org), a Berlin based transdisciplinary collective for prospective thinking driven by the will to question and discuss socio-political contexts and combine field of knowledge with spatial practice as starting point. In 2014, she coordinates and curates Berlin Unlimited (www.berlinunlimited.org), the first transdisciplinary festival about arts, architecture and urban planning drawing from multiples points of views and formats a contemporary vision of the city of Berlin through the observation of its limits and their evolution. In 2015, she investigates new ways of teaching/learning and she initiates the first Atelier d'Architecture Itinérant in collaboration with the Architecture School of Toulouse.

speakers.name: Arndt Pechstein
speakers.biography:
Dr. Arndt Pechstein is owner of the innovation agency 'phi360' and founder & president of 'Biomimicry Germany'. As an expert in biomimicry, design thinking, sustainable development & creative, team-based change processes he runs workshops and advises companies & organizations on human-centered innovation & strategic foresight, and teaches students in sustainability & cross-disciplinary problem-solving.

Arndt holds a PhD degree with honors in Neuroscience & Biochemistry and specialized in bio-inspired sustainable design & inventive problem solving to drive systemic innovation. He has been researcher & project manager at research institutes in Germany, Sweden, UK & USA and was awarded numerous scientific awards. He is co-founder & board member of the 'European Biomimicry Alliance', a transnational network of biomimicry design & innovation professionals. With his organization, Arndt was awarded the "Landmark 2014/15" Innovation Award by the German government and the Sustainability Award "Werkstatt N 2015" by the Council for Sustainable Development.

speakers.name: Kathrin Passig
speakers.biography: Kathrin Passig lebt in Berlin vom Schreiben von Sachbüchern und anderen zweifelhaften Tätigkeiten. Zuletzt erschien Ende 2013 das auf der re:publica 2010 für "diesen Herbst" angekündigte "Weniger schlecht programmieren" (O'Reilly Verlag, zusammen mit Johannes Jander).

speakers.name: Anna Galda
speakers.biography:
hat Stadt- und Regionalplanung studiert
	bloggt auf urbanophil.net
	hat 2009 den Verein zum Weblog mitgegründet

speakers.name: Norman Klüber
speakers.biography: Studierte Architektur an der Bauhaus Universität in Weimar und ist mit Umwegen über Kunst-, Radio- und Theatermachen für verschiedene Architekturbüros in Halle (Saale) tätig gewesen. Schwerpunkt energetische Gebäude- und Quartierssanierung. Seit 2012 als wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter am Fraunhofer Institut für Werkstoffmechanik Halle auf der Suche nach den ökologischen Dämmstoffen, innovativen Sanierungsstrategien und neuen Herausforderungen. An der Bauhaus-Universität Weimar hält er die Vorlesungsreihe Grundlagen Nachhaltiges Bauen.

speakers.name: Sebastian Quack
speakers.biography:
Sebastian Quack is an artist, game designer and curator working at the intersection of play, participation and the politics of urban society. Sebastian is a founding member of artist group Invisible Playground and curates Playpublik, an international festival for playful public spaces. He regularly teaches, gives talks and consults organizations on how to engage playfully with the world around them.

Sebastian holds an MA in cultural studies and computer science from Humboldt-University Berlin, and a fellowship from the Graduate School at Berlin University of the Arts. Early in his career, Sebastian worked on site-specific, participatory theater projects including Utopia Stock Exchange, before moving into game design by working on Area/Code’s plundr, the world’s first location-based PC game. Notable projects with Invisible Playground have since included Field Office, Lies In The Sand, Museum of Minor Incidents, 72 Hour Interactions – A World Championship of Gameful Architecture – and Turtle Wushu, a game that involves a tiny turtle sitting on your hand.

His newest project, Playful Commons, sets out to explore what kind of licenses administrators and users of public spaces can agree on when it comes to allowing play to take place.

speakers.name: Gilly Karjevsky
speakers.biography: Gilly Karjevsky (1979, Israel) is an independent curator and cultural planner. She holds an MA in Narrative Environments from Central Saint Martins College. Co-director of ‘72 Hour Urban Action’ - the international real-time architecture competition since 2010, with most recent projects in Germany, Denmark, Italy and Turkey. Founding curator at CAiR - Program for artists residencies in municipal departments. Member of the international artistic committee at ‘ArtCube’ artists residencies in Jerusalem. Curator of "Glocal Neighbours" - a program for knowledge exchange between neighbourhoods. Currently developing "Playful Commons" - a research project on applying ways to publicly license use of public space. Gilly's work is project-based, cross-disciplinary and collaborative, with a focus on projects which test artistic media in public institutions and public space. She is working hard to facilitate the integration of artists into processes of urban design and urban planning.

speakers.name: Andrej Holm
speakers.biography: Andrej Holm is an urban sociologist at Humboldt-University Berlin. Main research interests are in the field of gentrification, housing policy, neoliberal transformation of urban policy, and social urban movements.

speakers.name: Ralf Steeg
speakers.biography:
Diplomingenieur für Landschaftsarchitektur und Umweltplanung / Spezialisierte sich seit 1992 auf das Thema mittelalterliche Gärten und Landschaften / Kuratierte 10 Ausstellungen zum Thema Mensch und Natur / Entwickelt seit 2001 Syteme, die Abwassereinleitungen in Flüsse, Seen und Meere verhindern / Arbeitet seit 2003 am Projekt SPREE2011- Baden im Fluss. Mitten in Berlin – ein Projekt zur Reinigung der Spree / Ausgezeichnet vom Rat für Nachhaltigkeit: PROJEKT N

 

Einzel – und Gruppenausstellungen / Historisches Museum Bern / Museum für Moderne Kunst Bern / Galerie AEDES Berlin / Architekturbienale Venedig, Deutscher Pavillion, 2008 / Deutsches Architekturmuseum Frankfurt / Expo Shanghai 2010, Deutscher Pavillion / Martin-Gropius-Bau: Weltwissen. 300 Jahre Wissenschaften in Berlin / Nominiert für den Zumtobel-Group Award. Short List

speakers.name: Tetyana Bohdanova
speakers.biography:
A native of Lviv, Ukraine, Tetyana has spent the last ten years working in civil society development and studying impact of technology on activism in seven countries across Central and Eastern Europe and the former Soviet Union. Her experience ranges from advocating for local change, to promoting legislative reforms and defending free and fair elections in the region and beyond.

Since 2010, Tetyana writes about social media developments and digital activism in Ukraine and its neighbors for Global Voices, where she’s been instrumental in covering Ukraine’s EuroMaidan uprising and its aftermath.

With a Master’s degree from the Free University of Berlin, in her spare time Tetyana is an independent researcher and traveler.

speakers.name: Paula Glaser
speakers.biography: After her bachelor studies at the University of Applied Science in Offenburg, Paula Glaser worked for two years in e-commerce. In 2012 she decided to head in a new direction and started studying ‘Media in Education’ at the University of Pedagogies in Freiburg. During her studies she realized a scientific evaluation of ‘Jugend hackt 2014’ and started working for the ‘Open Knowledge Foundation Deutschland’ in February 2015, where she is organizing ’Jugend hackt’ together with Maria Reimer.

speakers.name: Lukas Hartmann
speakers.biography:
Lukas F. Hartmann is the technical co-founder of Spacedeck.com and works at the intersection of technology and communications. He programs computers since early childhood. During his studies at University of the Arts in Berlin, he co-created aka-aki, one of the earliest mobile social networks that had a global impact.

He embraces free and open source software and hardware and dabbles in programming language and operating system design where he focuses on minimalism and simplicity.

speakers.name: Gabriel Yoran
speakers.biography:
Gabriel Yoran is co-founder of consumer privacy software company Steganos and location-based social network, aka-aki. Products designed by Gabriel have earned numerous awards, including two Webby Awards, a Lead Award and numerous Best Buy and Product of the Year awards. He studied Communication in Social and Economic Contexts and holds a Master of Arts from Berlin University of the Arts. He is now a Ph.D. candidate at the European Graduate School (EGS) in Saas-Fee, Switzerland. He lives in Berlin, Germany and Rhode Island, USA.
On a lighter note, he tends to eavesdrop on people in cafés, anonymously live-tweeting the most absurd conversations (mostly German) at @cafedialoge.

speakers.name: Gunter Dueck
speakers.biography:
Gunter Dueck (Jahrgang 1951) lebt als freier Schriftsteller, Philosoph, Blogger, Business Angel und Speaker in Waldhilsbach bei Heidelberg. Er ist derzeit als einer der Initiatoren für das „Wiki of Music“ tätig. Nach einer Karriere als Mathematikprofessor arbeite er fast 25 Jahre bei der IBM, zuletzt bei seinem Wechsel in den Unruhestand als Chief Technology Officer. 

Dueck ist korrespondierendes Mitglied der Akademie der Wissenschaften zu Göttingen, Fellow des amerikanischen Ingenieursverbandes IEEE und Fellow der Gesellschaft für Informatik. Er ist Autor vieler Bestseller, zuletzt „Das Neue und seine Feinde“ und „Schwarmdumm“.

speakers.name: Ralf Bendrath
speakers.biography: Senior policy adviser to Jan Philipp Albrecht, MEP (Greens/EFA), working on internet policy and data protection, including in trade agreements. Also active in Digitale Gesellschaft and elsewhere. Former hacker, former researcher, former member of the German government delegation to the World Summit on the Information Society. Don't even mention data retention.

speakers.name: Ellery Biddle
speakers.biography:
Ellery Roberts Biddle is a writer, editor, and advocate for the protection of human rights as they exist on the global Internet. She is the director of Advox, the digital rights arm of Global Voices, which is dedicated to reporting on threats to online speech, sharing tactics for defending the digital work and words of citizens, and supporting efforts to strengthen Internet policy and practice worldwide. Global Voices is a multi-lingual volunteer citizen media network that amplifies unheard voices and perspectives on news stories from around the world.

Ellery is a 2014-15 fellow at Harvard’s Berkman Center for Internet & Society and has a dual Master’s degree from the University of Chicago, where she studied contemporary regional politics, media, and Internet policy in Latin America. She has particular expertise in digital culture and informal information economies in Cuba, where she has spent many months working as a student and researcher.

speakers.name: Fabian Hemmert
speakers.biography:
Fabian Hemmert is a design researcher, born and raised in Germany. During his studies towards an M.A. degree in Interface Design at FH Potsdam, he worked for Nintendo of Europe and Marvel Comics. He holds a doctorate in engineering (Dr.-Ing.) from the Berlin University of the Arts. In 2014, Fabian was a guest professor for interface design at Muthesius Kunsthochschule in Kiel.

Today, Fabian works as a researcher at the the Design Research Lab at the Berlin University of the Arts. His work focuses on new ways of interacting with technology.

Fabian is renowned to be one of the foremost thought-leaders in mobile telecommunication, having presented his work at multiple visionary events, including TED, the Chaos Communication Congress, and SXSW.

Fabian's TED talk on mobile phones of the future has been viewed more than 700.000 times and translated into 35 languages.

speakers.name: Thomas Gnahm
speakers.biography:
Direktor von Wear It Berlin – http://www.wearit-berlin.com, dem ersten Festival für wearable technologies in Berlin. Initiator von Trafo Pop – http://www.trafopop.com einem Open Source LED-Jacken Fahrradclub. Impulsgeber und Networker für Technologien am menschlichen Körper.

Thomas hat seinen Background in der Artdirection und Konzeption. Nach seinem Studium der visuellen Kommunikation an der Bauhaus Universität Weimar, dem Pratt Institute New York und an der EINA Barcelona hat er Berlin sein Designbüro wirhabenvielvor – http://www.wirhabenvielvor.de gegründet und zahlreiche renomierte Auszeichnungen für seine Arbeiten erhalten. Mit der Gründung der Fahrradgang Trafo Pop hat er ein interdisziplänres open source Projekt rund um Fahrräder und LED Jacken initiert. Darauf aufbauend rief er das Wear It Festival ins Leben, welches Designer, Ingenieure und Industrie zu dem Thema zusammenführt und einen fundierten Einblick in die internationale Szene bietet.

links.title: Trafo Pop - LED addicted bicycle club

speakers.name: Christine Corbett Moran
speakers.biography:
I do research in computational astrophysics, high performance computing, and big data visualization. I'm primarily interested in the gravitational force, which I consider the most beautiful and mysterious of all of nature's fundamental forces. In February 2015 I began a postdoc in theoretical physics at Caltech; I now live and work out of Los Angeles, California.

In my free time in the past, I have done a lot of open source and mobile application development oriented around technical activism, gender based violence and social justice, including major contributions to the Signal, Circle of 6, and Encyclopedia Android/iOS applications.

speakers.name: Malin Elmlid
speakers.biography: Born in Sweden and based in Berlin, Malin Elmlid is the founder of the trading network The Bread Exchange. With a business degree in network management and marketing from Lund University in Sweden, and a background in global sales management for the fashion industry, Elmlid has travelled the world looking for authentic stories. Since launching The Bread Exchange, she has traded more than 1400 sourdough loaves worldwide, in destinations including Berlin, the U.S., Belgium, Afghanistan and Morocco. *Bread is a global good," she says. Her book, The Bread Exchange: Tales and Recipes From a Journey of Baking and Bartering, was released in October 2014.

speakers.name: Carmen Hillebrand
speakers.biography:
Carmen Hillebrand ist Abteilungsleiterin Social Media & Content bei dem Großhändler METRO Cash & Carry Deutschland. Sie verantwortet den Auftritt des Unternehmens in sozialen Medien und ist unter anderem Chefredakteurin des METRO Genussblogs. Die studierte Literaturwissenschaftlerin ist äußerst Social Media affin und bezeichnet sich als Genussfanatikerin.

Sie kocht gerne, bloggt auch privat unter tanzaufdertomate.de und kennt sich sehr gut mit drei kulinarischen Themen aus: Craftbeer, Single Malt Whisky und Mett. Hillebrand blickt auf mehr als 14 Jahre Erfahrung in der Kommunikation zurück, vorwiegend im Bereich IT PR & Social Media. So war sie vor ihrem Eintritt bei der METRO im Jahr 2011 zuletzt Pressesprecherin Consumer von Vodafone Deutschland.

speakers.name: Hendrik Haase
speakers.biography:
I'm a trained designer, food activist, freelance author, artist and culinary curator, living and working in Berlin and on the road.

I'm known for culinary protest activities in public space combining the political and social dimensions of food with entertaining ideas which show people that sustainable eating can be fun, and indulgence should be celebrated.

One of my main interests lies in saving our world culinary heritage which is in danger to disappear by building bridges between production and consumption of our food.

speakers.name: Marcus Ammon
speakers.biography:
Marcus Ammon ist als Senior Vice President Film bei Sky Deutschland tätig. In dieser Funktion ist er für den Auf- und Ausbau der Sky Film- und Seriensender verantwortlich und nimmt maßgeblich Einfluss auf Verhandlungen mit Hollywood-Studios. Er hat unter anderem den Launch der Sender Sky 3D und Sky Atlantic HD sowie die Verpflichtung von Harald Schmidt bei Sky verantwortet. Mit über 15 Jahren Berufserfahrung blickt Ammon auf eine lange Karriere im deutschen Film- und Fernsehgeschäft zurück: Von 2003 bis 2009 war er Managing Director bei MGM Networks Deutschland GmbH, davor von 1999 bis 2002 Programmdirektor bei Universal Studios Networks Germany GmbH (heute: NBC Universal).

_____

Marcus Ammon is the Senior Vice President Film at Sky Deutschland. He is responsible for the set-up and expansion of the Sky film- and TV series channels and has significant influence on the negotiations with Hollywood studios. Among other projects, he lead the launch of the channels Sky 3D and Sky Atlantic HD as well as the engagement of Harald Schmidt at Sky. With more than 15 years of experience, Ammon has already had an extensive career in the German film and TV businesses. Between 2003 and 2009 he was the Managing Director of MGM Networks Deutschland GmbH; before that, he was the Program Director at Universal Studios Networks Germany GmbH (now: NBC Universal).

 

Marcus Ammon is a speaker @MEDIA CONVENTION Berlin

Find out more on Twitter: @MCBERLIN15 / #mcb15

speakers.name: Meret Becker
speakers.biography:
Bekannt wurde die gebürtige Bremerin Meret Becker Anfang der 1990er Jahre durch Sönke Wortmanns „Kleine Haie".  1991 gewann sie einen Grimme-Preis als Beste Nachwuchsdarstellerin für ihre Rolle als Rumänin Ali in „Fremde Liebe Fremde". Im Jahr 1993 erhielt sie für ihre tragenden Rollen in Margarethe von Trottas „Das Versprechen" (Berlinale-Eröffnungsfilm 1993) und in Dominik Grafs „Die Sieger" den Bayerischen Filmpreis. Für „Comedian Harmonists" gewann sie 1997 den Deutschen Filmpreis und die Goldene Kamera. Im gleichen Jahr zählte sie zum Ensemble von Helmut Dietls „Rossini". Meret Becker steht konstant für Film und Fernsehen vor der Kamera, zuletzt im Kinofilm „Quellen des Lebens" von Oskar Roehler (2011), in dem TV-Film „Die Lehrerin" (2011) und im Münchener „Tatort - In der Tiefe der Zeit" (2014) von Dominik Graf. Zu ihren bekannten Kinofilmen zählen des Weiteren: „Pünktchen und Anton", „Der Vulkan" (beide 1998), „Urlaub vom Leben" (2005), „Komm näher" (Berlinale Panorama 2006), „Meine schöne Bescherung" (2007) und „Boxhagener Platz" (2010). _____ A native of Bremen, Meret Becker first came to notice in the early 1990s in Sönke Wortmann’s “Little Sharks”. In 1991, she won a Grimme Award for best new actress for her role as the Romanian Ali in “Fremde Liebe Fremde”.
